含义: The character '死' means 'death' or 'to die'. It represents the end of life or the state of being dead.
字形: The character '死' is composed of two parts: the left part '歹' (dǎi), which means 'bad' or 'evil', and the right part '匕' (bǐ), which is an ancient form of a spoon or ladle. Together, they symbolize the concept of death.
读音: The pronunciation of '死' is 'sǐ' in Mandarin Chinese.
字源: The character '死' originates from ancient Chinese pictographs. The left part '歹' originally depicted a cracked bone, symbolizing decay or death, while the right part '匕' was used to represent a tool or instrument, possibly indicating the act of dying.
含此字的字: 殉 (xùn) - to die for a cause
成语: 死而复生 (sǐ ér fù shēng) - to come back to life
死里逃生 (sǐ lǐ táo shēng) - to escape from death

例句: 他宁愿死也不愿投降。 (Tā nìngyuàn sǐ yě bùyuàn tóuxiáng.) - He would rather die than surrender.
死有重于泰山，轻于鸿毛。 (Sǐ yǒu zhòng yú Tàishān, qīng yú hóngmáo.) - Death can be as heavy as Mount Tai or as light as a feather.
短故事: In ancient China, there was a famous general who chose to die rather than surrender to his enemies. His story is often told to illustrate the concept of honor and loyalty.
Another story involves a scholar who faked his own death to escape political persecution, only to return years later to reclaim his position.
